p: Fortunately, the Indian Government is currently focusing on nutrition (besides food), safety, and increasing farmers’ income (rather than increasing agricultural productivity). Appropriate plans and incentives to change consumer behavior are already on the agenda. For all of these things to happen, the current state of policy incentives that favor the two main staple foods, wheat, and rice needs to be changed. In the post-COVID-19 scenario, agricultural policy design should include these basic elements of the transformation of India’s food system [30].
